Is there a way to move the little PR window or toggle it via a toolbar button or so? As it is, it's sitting smack dab in the middle of the Kerbal Engineer info panel (that I really don't want to move) ![:/](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/ZNGIcon1.png ":/")

I dont know about \*moving\* it (which would be nice to be able to do), but as to toggling it, yes... You click the square button on the right, and there are three options:  

Always Visible, Stock Toolbar, Blizzy Toolbar.  

If you have the Toolbar mod installed, click the "Blizzy" option, and you can add a PR button on the Blizzy Toolbar which will toggle the PR window on/off... or likewaise, if you select "Stock Toolabr" it will add the toggle icon to the stock toolbar.

Hi all. I'm wanting to set an exact orientation and rotation so that it doesn't drift over time.

I had a look at the save files but after a bit of futile experimentation with the rotation quaternion and direction vector I gave up.

Anyone got any suggestions for this sort of thing?

Thanks

For me, what works depends on what I want to set my rotation relative to. I tend not to use Dynamic, as I prefer to choose the reference body myself. 

Then I switch on <abbr title="Stability Augmentation System">SAS</abbr> and let it be. I find that my vehicles tend to hold that relative positioning over time. Example: I have a vehicle with fixed solar panels en route from Kerbin to the Mun. I change the reference body to the Sun, set my orientation as I choose, set <abbr title="Stability Augmentation System">SAS</abbr> to on, and then let it go.

I have not, however, updated yet to 1.7.3. 

Hope this helps!
